conclusion: The question asks how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the right above the objects.
There are four objects above the slabs casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on the ground.
When the light source moves to the right, it will be closer to the objects, resulting in smaller shadows.
The light source will be above the objects, causing the shadows to be cast directly below the objects.
Since the light source is moving to the right, the shadows will move to the left to maintain their position directly below the objects.
A, B, C, and D will all move to the left and become smaller.
